resources.string:
This video explains the difference
between a primary key and foreign key
A primary key uniquely identifies any 
record in a table, while a foreign key
 is used to reference occurrences of an 
entity in another table.
Sorry, the YouTube player failed to initialize. Please try again.

string-array.name: moduleDescriptions
string-array.item: Learn about tables, primary keys, foreign keys \nand relationships.
Learn about entity relationship diagrams and\nrelational models.
Learn how to create a database in SQL\n using the CREATE TABLE Statement and \nthe INSERT INTO Statement.
Learn about different statements you can\n use to query the database, such as\n SELECT and UPDATE statements.
